subject: RE: [junit] Eclipse - JUnit Configuration?
msgSnippet: ... Hi, Most people get by fine with allowing 127.0.0.1 as the loopback address.  You might enter a bug with the Eclipse folks for your esoteric super-secure
messageBody:
> On Mon, 2004-04-26 at 18:48, Clark I Anderson wrote:
> > I do not THINK I am running in Debug Mode.
> >
> > The Eclipse Debug settings are at their default values.
> >
> > IPConfig results: 127.0.0.1 is not the development PC's IP.
> >
> > I start from the menu with: Run/Run As /JUnit Test
> > I can ping 127.0.0.1; but ZoneAlarm is set to Ask
> permission for access
> > any port at that IP.
> >
> > The port number that is requested varies.
> >
> > With ZoneAlarm, I tried approving access to 127.0.0.1:?????
> and The test
> > program ran achieving the 'green bar'.
> >
> > Why is it using RemoteTestRunner?
> >
> > Is my problem learning how to use/configure Eclipse/JUnit?
> > OR
> > Is it my own system configuration?

Hi,

Most people get by fine with allowing 127.0.0.1 as the loopback address. You might enter a bug with the Eclipse folks for your esoteric super-secure configuration, and ask for a configuration mechanism to set the IP address for the RemoteTestRunner. But, if you can, just re-enable 127.0.0.1 as the loopback address.

My hypothesis is that the RemoteTestRunner was written to support Eclipse plugin testing, where the test launcher creates a new Eclipse workspace to run a set of plugin tests. The results are displayed in the original workspace's test runner UI. That is, the RemoteTestRunner talks over RMI or HTTP to the new launched workspace to get the test results.

Scott Stirling
